intro: Psydrax graniticola, commonly known as the granite rock fig, is a rare and unique plant native to the rocky environments of southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the Moraceae family. Its fruit is a small, round fig-like structure that is edible and often consumed by local wildlife. Due to its limited habitat and threats from human activity, Psydrax graniticola is considered a vulnerable species.
